website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty hose that mostly lives up to its name, and stands up to weather, mold and more.
pros: Features Reflex Mesh Technology for easy, kink-free use
Protects against mold and mildew with anti-microbial Micro Shield technology
Lead-free aluminum used to make industrial strength couplings
cons: Despite its name and relatively high price point, it sometimes develops kinks and bulges

customer_reviews.title: Will kink, bulge, and burst.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted exactly one year before it burst at one of the many bulges it developed since I purchased it. Used only for light garden work.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: defective water hose
customer_reviews.text: The hose sprang a leak in just one month. I don't think it can be mailed due to water on the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Does not last.  Only had it for 1 Year!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the hose for almost 1 year, and it ruptured near the nozzle end. I have not used it more than once a week, and always made sure to turn the water off when done, so the pressure was not always on. It started with a bubble that continued to grow, and got worse. Only one year of use??? I've had much cheaper hoses that lasted up to 10 years. Very disappointed with the quality. I bought the Commercial quality expecting I would not have to get a new one for a very long time. The price for this hose is unsubstantiated since it only lasted one year.
customer_reviews.author: justin ilumin

customer_reviews.title: NeverKink 8844-100 Series, Not Usable:(
customer_reviews.text: I just received the NeverKink 8844-100 Series 4000 Commercial Duty hose. I was very disappointed when I discovered that the hose was not connected to the end part which screws into a faucet. It is completely useless to me, so I am sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: T. Reader

customer_reviews.title: Burst the first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: The hose developed a bubble and burst on during first use. I had it hooked up outside to wash my car. I filled up the wash buckets and gave the car a first rinse. That's when I noticed the bubble forming on the hose. I began to take pictures as it swelled and finally burst. I assume I got a dud since it burst the first time I used it. The connections seemed to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bob

customer_reviews.title: Seems built well but continues to get stuck on faucet and attachments
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Neverkink hose that has got stuck, only this time it snapped off my faucet trying to remove it. I have one of these in the front and back yard. They're seem to be built very well.This is the second hose to get stuck where neither the sprayer nozzle nor the faucet would disconnect without some force. Today, the use of force broke the faucet off the pipe. The old faucet is still stuck to the hose. Tried using two sets of plumbing pliers and still no luck. I've only had the hose since June. Thankfully fixed the faucet myself instead of hiring a plumber.
customer_reviews.author: tavella

customer_reviews.title: Hard to roll up correctly with out kinking it.
customer_reviews.text: This item will kink. Hard to roll up correctly with out kinking it. being in the oilfield, building roads and bridges, working as a state inspector, would not consider this Commercial quality
customer_reviews.author: Barry S.

customer_reviews.title: So far no Kinks! Update!
customer_reviews.text: I hate hoses! I hate the tangles and the kinks in the lines as your trying to walk around your yard and patio to water. I think I finally found the answer in this hose. I has been great. I got 100ft and I think that was too much. I ordered a second one only this time 50ft. Good luck Update, so I have managed to kink this hose but still it is far and away the best hose for the money
customer_reviews.author: Susan Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Hose
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this product April 1, 2017 and this product is still working out great for me. My garden hose is exposed to the brutal Florida sun most of the time. I had no issues of bulging or bursting the 2 years I had this hose. No mold growth anywhere on the hose. Just clean and works how it was intended. I am very pleased. :D Was planning on looking for a shorter version (3 feet) if they got one. Thank you for this awesome hose. ^.^♥ Will buy again from this merchant. :D
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M. P.

customer_reviews.title: Leaked like crazy right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I liked that this hose had a lifetime guarantee and was made in the USA. However, on its first use, it leaked like crazy at the point it was attached to the house water outlet even though it has a plastic gasket. I might add, it was like wrestling an anaconda to get the thing uncoiled so that might be something to consider as well if you are thinking about this hose. It is going back from whence it came.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: False claims, do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not believe the hype. 'Neverkink' is a falsification. I have had two of these one season, they were never kept out in the sun and drained in the winter. Sure enough, they kink just like a cheap trashy hose you can buy at half the price. I am contacting the Class Action organization to challenge this false claim, and if there are enough of us, we'll but a stop to this irresponsible advertising from this company. Do not buy this thinking you are getting quality, you are getting a normal hose with a worthless guarantee that you can never collect on. I'm sure they are making lots of money on this, and it just isn't right.
customer_reviews.author: Cu

customer_reviews.title: very nice hose and great value
customer_reviews.text: So I really only needed about 75 feet but for the money had to go with the 100. Very pleased with the hose and use if with my power washer which is not always running but the water pressure is on. Hose held the pressure fine and didn't kink up on me when pulling around the job. The end connectors are great too, nice tight fit almost like nut and bolt. Hopefully it gives me a few years of service but I will buy again and am going to get another one for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Neverkink 8844-100 Series 4000 Commerical Duty Pro Garden Hose
customer_reviews.text: You can not go wrong with this garden hose. Keep the paper that comes with the hose, if it ever kinks the company will replace it free if you have the receipt too and date of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: loved

customer_reviews.title: Built wrong
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today. I have extra watering now that it’s been warmer. Sadly I still have to spend more time and frustration with what I have because this came defective. Unable to use with any nozzle. Kind of defeats the purpose. I did put in for an exchange, so hopefully that’s quick and returns with a quality hose that you can actually connect things to. If that happens my rating will change. Update: 7-10-3019 Already got my new hose and it’s made properly this time. Haven’t gotten to use it yet but hoping it doesn’t Kink which is why I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: great hose
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 100' model of this brand last year and was so impressed that I bought this 50' one to use on another part of my irrigation setup. They are harder to handle, but I haven't had one kink on me yet and seem like they will last a long time. I started using Teflon tape on the threads because some of the cheaper hoses I've gotten have corroded solidly together. I'm not sure these needed it, but I figured I'd rather be safe than sorry. I had to cut off the ends of those other hoses. It seems whenever I do that, the repair ends always leak. No problems with these two hoses yet.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: its heavy and NOT commercial quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it about a year ago, and actually used it for 20 times, and it already has a bulk in one place, and I will have a leak there shortly. I'm not sure about the warranty of this product, but based on my experience I would not recommend it, as I purchased it as a commercial Duty hose. I used some "cheap" hoses before that lasted many years. On top of this the hose is very heavy, therefore difficult to move around.
customer_reviews.author: zipzip

customer_reviews.title: Ummmm...it Kinks!
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping this would do what it promises...convey water and not kink. Unfortunately, regardless of what type of holder, what the weather is, or how careful I am using....it kinks. Because it is heavy duty, you can't "flick" the hose to get the kink out and continue. No. Shut off the water at the nozzle, find the kink(s), try to straighten, or "flip" them to get the water flowing. This make the watering of pots and plants, in a 30x30 area, a much longer task than needed. I don't think I received a damaged item, just one that doesn't do the job promised. Suggest you look elsewhere to find a "NEVERKINK" professional hose.
customer_reviews.author: Trshayala

customer_reviews.title: Will give it 5 stars if they change the name!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this hose kinks, has no problems kinking. HOWEVER, this is a very nice, high quality hose, it's still very worth every penny. You can quite easily whip out the kink with little effort. Maybe just change the name of the hose, Neverkink isn't exactly accurate. Or maybe that's the strategy... People buy the hose, it kinks, but they don't wanna send it back cuz damn it's a good hose!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess W.

customer_reviews.title: Best hose ever!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this hose, especially at the price. Our apartment complex has multiple tenants using this in the garage, plus the maintenance crew. In the past year we've gone through a half dozen cheaper hoses. They kink, get driven over, leak and spray all over. This one cures all that, so it's worth buying quality instead of cheap "pocket hoses" that last about a month at most. My suggestion: get a decent reel to go with it. I chose the Suncast Sidetrackerspecifically because it reels in from the side, not the front. It handles this 100 foot hose well.
customer_reviews.author: Tomorthomas

customer_reviews.title: Still kinks.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this because a previous NeverKink Commercial hose was replaced by Apex under their Lifetime Warranty guarantee. The warranty process was fast painless and so we bought this hose as the replacement. Unfortunately this hose is develops kinks, even when we take great care to properly wind it up in the hose realer every time. This hose actually came out of the packaging with a permanent kink already in it! The only good thing is that Apex stands behind their lifetime warranty and there's something to be said for that.
customer_reviews.author: DeeAyGee

customer_reviews.title: Great surprise, great product
customer_reviews.text: Been using this brand garden hose for years with no problems...It will, however, kink once in a while but no where like a lot of other brands and usually easily remedied by just pulling on the hose where you are gripping it so no big deal...Here's where the surprise came from...Needed an extra 100 footer so decided to get it from Amazon...price was 31.66 whereas big box store was 39.98...didn't really pay attention to the description since I was familiar with the product...BUT to my surprise when it arrived it was actually the COMMERCIAL grade hose...about 8.00 less than the standard grade I was used to getting...just another reason I place about a zillion orders from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Greatescape

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the Sun Shine Down on These
customer_reviews.text: For the the price I didn't expect a top notch nose, as the rubber ones are much pricier at longer lengths. The PRO hose has nice fittings, handles 85 PSI just fine with no leaks after weeks of use, and isn't bad looking. Unfortunately, it did take a little time to massage it back into a larger workable coil after being in it's super tight packaging. Since it is dark colored plastic that heats up/breaks down faster I throw an old rug (tapestry now?) over the hose reel to keep the UV off.
customer_reviews.author: SuperTurboExtraGnarly

customer_reviews.title: 5 week failure
customer_reviews.text: Bulged in the first month. This hose was hooked to my home outdoor faucet and developed a huge bulge about 8 inches behind the nozzle. I have another brand on the other side of the house and it has been in use 2 years with no issues. I bought it at Sams club for a bit more than this. I guess you get what you pay for. I will attempt to get a replacement since it says a lifetime guarantee. I'll update that later, but for now I am not buying anymore of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: MustangChief

customer_reviews.title: NO, it will burst!
customer_reviews.text: My new hose burst... what a weak POS! This was in residential light-duty use, spraying out dramatically in 3 directions....
customer_reviews.author: F. Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Flexible And Kinks :
customer_reviews.text: I should NOT HAVE ORDERED the Commercial Version because it tends to tangle / kink frequently, due to Stronger and Thicker rubber composition ( Commercial Product). The Brown Version of Technor Apex Hoses for Homeowners, is less likely to Kink based on the 3 - 4 of that Version I currently own. After trying many - many - many brands of Hoses, I am convinced their are no "Completely Kink Free " Hoses. We all need to live with that reality, as long as it is not Frequent. Buy The Less Expensive Brown / Technor Homeowner Version.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: No washer will fit - opening not drilled correctly
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I ordered two of these hoses on February 26, 2019, and yesterday, July 9, 2019, one of the hoses blew a hole in it and had to be thrown away. I do not recommend this product and strongly urge Amazon to reconsider offering it for sale on it's site. I bought two of these. One had both washers in place, the other one has one washer in place. When trying to fit a universal washer into the opening it was drilled too small for any washer to fit, thereby, there will always be a leaking end. The company did not send any extra washers, and even if it had, they would not fit because of the opening being misdrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Well the reason I ordered this hose is because it ...
customer_reviews.text: Well the reason I ordered this hose is because it says "never kink". The first thing I unravel it, guess what? That's right, it kinked. So i give it the benefit of the doubt and you know what? It still kinks. So if your ordering this hose cause it says never kink, well you can find out for yourself or learn from me.
customer_reviews.author: christopher Takitani

customer_reviews.title: It kinks
customer_reviews.text: The hose held up for about 3 months. The good thing about the hose it the connectors are pretty well-made, but I think the reason why someone would make the decision to buy the hose is the fact that they don't kink. My hose now kinks very easily and is a constant struggle to use. I think I would prefer my cheap hose I had before over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Cayer

customer_reviews.title: Luck of the draw, no doubt
customer_reviews.text: Good thing it's guaranteed. After attaching the hose to my hose reel I noticed the water pressure was pathetic. Once I started looking at the hose on the reel and unwound it, I found plenty of kinks (stopped counting at 7) and couldn't get the hose to straighten out. Who needs a hose that barely allows water to flow??? Sending it back today. BTW, I have the same hose I bought some years ago at a hardware store - never had a problem with that one and it's still going strong. Guess that was money well spent, and will be spent again for a second one.
customer_reviews.author: uhoh

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 30 minutes. Possible manufacturing defect.
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a solid heavy duty hose upon opening it. Unfortunately, I only used the hose for 30 mins before it lost pressure and I heard gushing water behind me. I looked back only to find a 6 inch gash midway down. This hose never touched anything (no concrete, fences, etc.) other than soft grass so I can only assume it was a possible manufacturers defect. It will be returned promptly and I will be seeking something better. It didn't kink but it definitely leaked under a standard workload and within a half hour of hooking it up for the first time. I reluctantly give it 3 stars only because I truly believe it to be a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Hose burst after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The hose fittings seem to be high quality but, unfortunately, we had to replace the male end after just over 3 months of light usage because the hose burst next to that end. The hose does kink a bit more than you would think based on the name but not so much, so far, that it doesn't work. The fact that the hose failed so soon makes this item not very appealing. At 4 months the hose has burst again near the male end. This level of quality is FAR from what one would expect from a product that CLAIMS to be professional quality. I urge buyers to avoid this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Don Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Which I'd bought two!
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased water hoses at home improvement stores or garden centers. I had been looking for one for a while, but I hadn't found a price I liked for a 100' one. I decided to check amazon on a whim and came across this one. Excellent price and reviews. You'd be hard pressed to find a better deal at a store. It hooked up easily and works perfectly. My only complaint is I wish I could've selected a different color; the black is not really my style but clearly this does not affect it from working properly. I should've bought a second one bc the price has gone up since I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen W

customer_reviews.title: Love this hose
customer_reviews.text: Love this hose! We wind it up every time we use it in hose pot on the ground. As we pull it out of the hose pot there are sometimes when I am not paying attention that the hose 'kinks' - any hose when I pull hard enough as you are uncoiling it will kink. Unlike my old hose I would have to go over and untangle/unkink it - not this one - I just bounce it and it usually just unkinks. My only issue is that it is jet black with a red line on it. When sitting in the sun, glistening, it kind of looks like a black racer snake.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Ok for outside but not great
customer_reviews.text: The hose seems great overall however I purchased two and one of them won’t fit on my faucet properly and leaks terribly! I thought it was something I was doing at first but it’s not. In addition, if the hose is in the sun and heats up at all, it kinks pretty easily. Unfortunately I don’t think I can return it at this point due to the time that has passed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Grzeczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Not commercial at all, Blew a bubble after few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the hose Advertised as commercial and it’s not I purchase 3, one 100 foot and two 50 feet One blew a bubble being in the sun for few hours after only couple month of use. The second one is about to blow, a bubble is already forming. I always release the pressure but we have some client who don’t. And those hoses will not hold pressure without blowing in the first few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre O Paquelier

customer_reviews.title: FEMALE END LEAKS and is NOT NEVERKINK
customer_reviews.text: waited for it all this time and the female end just pisses out water, whats even funnier is it was pissing out all that water and it wasnt even attatched to anything yet. thats how bad this hose is.all my other hoses dont leak so it is the hose. this hose is also NOT a neverkink hose because i kinked it 4 times just trying to water my flower garden and it FULLY stops flow. id like my money back, this is absolutely ridiculous. now i have to go to walmart instead to get one because i wont get a broken hose there.
customer_reviews.author: wew lad

customer_reviews.title: Used to be Brass, now Aluminum fittings
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this brand for last 30 years. Have only bought 3 100ft hoses in 1992, just recently had to replace them. The reason they lasted so long is that NeverKink made them with all Brass Fittings. Apparently, they no longer make their hoses with Brass Fittings, which when purchased in 1992 cost $98.00 each from Lowes. Now they make the fittings out of Aluminum. Do not know about fitting durability. What a shame, I would pay that price again for the same service life.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy m.

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not great, hose.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to beat this for the price, but it's not a great hose. It came crimped from the zip-ties, but was fine after a warm evening. Will it kink? Yes, but not too badly, although it would be less of an issue if the hose didn't have so much "memory" (which hopefully will lessen over time). The biggest issue is the aluminum fittings. They seem well molded, and at least mine were not sharp. But compared to brass, they scratch incredibly easily on stone, cement, brick, etc., so I do question their durability. I have a 15+ year hose with brass fittings, and they remain in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: DC JAKE

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long but has lifetime warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hose thinking it was the best of the best. While at first it seemed like a good hose it didn’t last as long as it supposed to. In under two years the hose cracked and started leaking and a coupling started to leak as well. Had to invoke warranty to replace it. While the hose didn’t last long the warranty is legit and is for lifetime. Bottom line. Hose won’t last long but warranty has got you covered. I’m half half on this hose since will probably have to change every few years. I’ve had cheaper hose last 6 years without having to change so fast.
customer_reviews.author: Glorious Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Our other hose kinked like crazy and drove me crazy! This appears to work great! **UPDATE** I drained the hose, rolled it up, and put it in the garage for the winter then brought it out and hooked it up in the spring only to have water leaking out of where it connects to the hose bib. The company was going to send me a new one as a replacement then I realized that it was the rubber gasket that apparently dried out a little and shrunk creating the leak. I called back to explained the problem and they promptly sent me some new rubber washers. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Good hose unless you want to make repairs on it
customer_reviews.text: Carries water, resistant to desert heat but if you do get a hole and want to repair it good luck. There is an inner layer that makes it to small for the 5/8 inch repair piece to fit inside. I had to cut it away with a straight razor to get it to fit inside. My other hoses that are 5/8 didn't have this issue and they were commercial. I will not buy these again strictly for this reason. Lowes has a hose so close in model and price that I would rather buy it there. For the price you pay I cant afford to buy a new hose everytime a horse chews a simple hole in the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Mohler

customer_reviews.title: NEVERKINK HAD A KINK WHEN IT ARRIVED NEW
customer_reviews.text: This product had a kink when it arrived. I Swear its true. I opened box of two 75 footers and one was already kinked. Sent both back. Quality control lf any is terrible. If you get the ones I sent back the kink is visible without even unrolling the hose and still strapped.
customer_reviews.author: gstet

customer_reviews.title: Good hose
customer_reviews.text: I gave only two stars for Light Weight, because that is not a good thing for a H.D. hose. This is my 3Rd Teknor hose, but the 1st one with red stripe (others are yellow). I often forget to shut the water off and the Summer Sun in Georgia has caused several hoses to burst. My main Teknor is 3yrs. old and still looks and works fine. Even after sitting all day and night with the water on. If the water is on, your hose won't kink. If it's empty and been rolled for a while it might, but not much.
customer_reviews.author: Breeze3at

customer_reviews.title: Love the hose
customer_reviews.text: How do you rate stretch of a hose that is xfeet long? It isn't supposed to stretch is it? Anyway, I saw this hose on the daily deals and picked it. I love it. It doesn't get caught on things and cut off the water flow. It is heavy when it is filled with water and I am not as strong as I once was. But it is filled with water so you expect that. I would highly recommend this hose to anyone looking for a great value for the dollar with a high quality hose. One of the best hoses I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Motor City Girl

customer_reviews.title: Hose came with two Kinks. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Hose was delivered fast through Amazon. Hose was Factory wrapped and came with two"KINKS". I should have sent it back but I needed it right away. Washer in hose to stop leaking was faulty and had to replace immediately. Good thing I have spares. If you need a hose right away and want to waste $20 then this hose is for you. I should have spent twice as much and got a far superior hose. UPDATE: 5 DAYS after delivery hose split wide open. Hose did not freeze no water was in hose. Back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: Should be "Almost Neverkink"!
customer_reviews.text: I have two Neverkink "Heavy Duty" 50' hoses and thought I'd try the "Commercial" one thinking it might be less inclined to kink. This one is good, but I think the "Heavy Duty" hoses are better. Neither one kinks much, but they do kink. This Commercial one tends to spew water at the faucet both with and without the included washer in the coupling, while the HD one doesn't as much. They are very good hoses and I use them almost daily. The prices are close to the same, so I'd go with the heavy duty one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great hose
customer_reviews.text: This hose is exactly what I had been looking for. We really needed a 100 ft hose that would be durable and not break the bank. This hose fits those expectations perfectly. We frequently move this about the yard as we have a garden that is quite far from our hose bib and it is light weight and durable enough to do that multiple times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Khelsea L. Borror

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst hose I have ever had - it kinks every time I move it - incredibly frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Usually this brand is good for quality - I have never had a problem before This particular hose is the worst one I think I have ever used - seriously, every time you pull on the hose to move it across the pool deck it kinks so the water stops. I had never used it until last week and that is when the disappointment started. Probably 2 things working against it - 5/8" diameter and 100' length > a bad combination if the hose is not really strong (which I figured this would be)
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: No kink hose
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I hate watering the plants normally, because the hose always would bend. Then the water wouldn't flow. I'd have to go back , and forth to fix it. With this hose it doesn't kink, so no more fustration with yard work! So happy!
customer_reviews.author: Michele B

customer_reviews.title: Industrial Waste
customer_reviews.text: Never Kink! Well, it might not kink but it is so stiff it is hard to roll and unroll. I bought two of these and when Fall came to Wisconsin I decided to remove them from the front and back spigots. Our water in Madison is not all that hard (NEVER been a problem removing hose hook-ups) but these hose hookups were absolutely welded to the outdoor faucets. Had to take a knife and cut them loose. Unless you plan on removing these on a regular basis, do not bother. Or, just make sure you buy a good quality cutting tool when it comes time to remove them.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Andrews

customer_reviews.title: verrrrrrry stifff
customer_reviews.text: The product information is very misleading. It said would remain flexible to 45 deg, which it does not, even to 60 it is too stiff to coil. I needed 3/4 for volume and got this one. Yes I live in cold country, but even when it is warm remains to stiff to coil, even large loops. So now I will be tossing it and getting something different. I got ripped off. First bad thing I ever got from Amazon. I had it neatly coiled and when the temp dropped it became uncoiled and came off the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: If you really want a hose that does not kink ...
customer_reviews.text: If you really want a hose that does not kink - do not buy this product. Even taking it out of the package and winding it on the hose real the first time, it kinked on me several times. As I have used it more this summer I continue to have problem with the hose kinking to the point that I will not use it with my pressure washer for fear of it kinking and losing water pressure to the machine.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Neverkink name is misleading
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hose because it claims that it will not kink. After using it for 2 years, I would classify that claim as false advertising. While watering plants this evening, I came to my wits end because I had to stop and unkink the damn hose multiple times. The fittings are well made and the hose gets the job done if you don't mind walking back several feet on a repeated basis to unkink it while you move it from location to location.
customer_reviews.author: James Parker

customer_reviews.title: Meh, it popped on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Looked really good out of the box, I thought I got a really nice hose. I go to screw it on and realized the hose looked funny where it meets one of the aluminum couplers, thought nothing of it. Started using the hose and it popped right at the coupler, I cut it and just installed a normal barbed coupler with a regular clamp and problem solved. The hose itself has worked good so far, just disappointed at the quality control. 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pernell DC

customer_reviews.title: Leaked badly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it looked heavy duty especially where you connect at the water source. I unrolled the hose, screwed it in tight to a newly installed spigot and screwed on the nozzle at the other end. I turned on the water and immediately water was spewing out at 2 different locations at the water spigot. I tried 3 different times and same results. Needless to say I returned it. Also, you can not drink from this hose and it spells terrible. This is a bad bad product all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: zap

customer_reviews.title: Good hose but does kink
customer_reviews.text: I do really like this hose (and bought a second one) but don't believe the "no kinks" hype. I use mine for watering bonsai and it kinks almost every day and in exactly the same spot so apparently once you get a kink you have it forever. I've found that if I carefully rotate and flip the hose when I change direction I can avoid the kink but the hose is fairly heavy so it can be difficult to get the kink out once you have one especially if you have limited space to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel White

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I've used neverkink hoses for a while now. Compared to what else is out there, they are ok. I bought two of these "pro" hoses and two months in...with little use, one of them blew a hole when I was pulling it across the driveway. Now I have to make the first of what I'm sure will be many repairs. I wish they made these like they did 10 years ago. On another note, the flexzilla hose repair kits are awesome...but expensive.
customer_reviews.author: E.J. Kukoly

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum Terminations N/G
customer_reviews.text: Have used for about 1 year. The aluminum male and female end fittings are very hard to screw on and off. Most hoses use brass fittings - that's what Grand Dad recommended, and how right he is. My brass fittings screw on and off easily after years - these are corroded and hard to assemble. Grease helps.
customer_reviews.author: Sailorman

customer_reviews.title: It really does not kink as some state that and they do.
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor bought one of these and I liked it and we have 4 to replace. So I ordered one to try. The only difference was that it was a smaller circumference than hers. But it is great and I will replace all with this brand. It does NOT kink, a claim some make and the first thing one would do is kink....not this one. Easy to use and maneuver as I have to fill water tubs for horses and have to pull a distance. We have gone thru other hoses and been very disappointed at their quality but this one is works for me for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Joy S.

customer_reviews.title: No Other Hose Will Do
customer_reviews.text: I discovered this hose on Amazon a few years back and bought one. It instantly became my favorite hose for three reasons: (1) It fastens easily and tightly to the hose bib so there's no water leakage; (2) it doesn't kink up when using; and (3) it winds up nice and neat. I've already bought four more (50-ft and 100-ft). When the gardener offered to bring us a hose or two, I told him, "No thanks. I've got this one" - and went to Amazon to buy this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Stinky!
customer_reviews.text: The hose itself functions as it should. Nothing seems cheap about it. But I have never had a hose that came anywhere close to the level of melted plastic smell that this thing puts off. We've had it in use and uncoiled for at least two weeks now, and even after coming inside and washing my hands I can still smell it as I go about other activities. Makes me wonder what kind of chemicals are coming off of this thing. *1 year later we're pitching it, the water still smells like chemicals, it comes out mysteriously frothy, and it absolutely kinks.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best Hose I Ever Owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy duty and never kinks or goes flat. I just left it on the ground all winter (I know...wrong). But I have been using it this summer and not a kink or anything. Yes it is heavy, but I don't care as long as it is this good. The ends are still in great shape for screwing and unscrewing. The only thing that would make it better is if it were drinking water quality, so I could drink out of it. Giving it 5 anyway.
customer_reviews.author: NiteShopping

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a hose that doesn't bend all the time, but this one has not done it to me so far. It is a 100ft so you would expect to get kinks somewhere down the line, however I'm very impressed! I have to say the hose has a strong smell and taste of rubber/plastic or whatever its made of so I would not suggest to use it for consumption for animals or pets. Hopefully it goes away after a few of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L

customer_reviews.title: Very good hose.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely solid hose. Very good quality connectors. My only complaint is that the hose is quite rigid. But given that, I do expect it to last a very very long time. It's a hose, so there isn't too much to say other than it seems to convey water as expected. The connectors don't leak and the strain relief is very effective. It does not kink, as one might expect given the name. I used this hose to help protect our home during the fires here in California and it performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey W. Larvenz

customer_reviews.title: Hose DOES kink and easily I found
customer_reviews.text: Hose DOES kink and easily I found. IT is well made, actually beautiful and sturdy with fine fittings at both ends. It is quite heavy and very likely best suited for construction project rather than home use. To say it does not kink (my biggest reason for buying it) is false marketing at its best. If you buy it and don't use a very heavy duty hose reel, you will have trouble coiling it up in the garden area. The promo does say COMMERCIAL DUTY and they are correct. Find something better for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Better use teflon tape and hope that prevents a dissimilar metal reaction.
customer_reviews.text: All was going well until I attempted to remove for the winter. It appears that the female coupling is made of a metal that interacted woith my brass spigot. When I tried to remove the hose was so fused to the spigot it caused the spigot to fail and the male portion of the spigot is fused inside the hose making the hose useless, unless I cut off the Coupling and replace it with a repair coupling.
customer_reviews.author: JIM OF TROPHY CLUB

customer_reviews.title: BUYERS BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I should have believed all of the reviews which stated the this hose "arrived kinked" because of the way it was packaged. The hose looks really good, so the problem is that the manufacturer has to fix the problem with the way the wrapping straps are made so tight that they cause permanent kinks in the hose. I obviously have no idea how long it would have lasted without the kinks. Anyway-- BUYERS BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Altman

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to roll up
customer_reviews.text: It does get some kinks when rolling it up. Even after laying in the sun all day it is still one of the most difficult hoses to roll I’ve ever tried to roll up. The only worse ones are the super cheap hoses. It’s oddly hard to pull along on the ground too. To roll it takes 10 minutes, sweaty, frustrating, and won’t lay round on the hose reel no matter how much effort you put into it, and you will put in a ton. This thing is isn’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnazon

customer_reviews.title: Neverkink?  Haha!!!! and very chemically smell.
customer_reviews.text: About 6 weeks after being installed on a hose roller this hose developed a kink! Now it kinks almost every time I use it, which is almost daily! It also has a noticeable chemical smell and foams up a little when I first turn the water on and it goes through the water that was in the hose. So far it's not affecting the plants, but I would not drink it and I don't put it in the bird bath. I've used it about 50 times and it's still there.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Quality garden hose
customer_reviews.text: There are few things I loath more than a cheap, flimsy garden hose that kinks every time you tug at it and coils up like a rats nest when you’re through with it. Not this baby. This is a seriously nice garden hose. So happy that I purchased several more to outfit the garden properly. Don’t skimp on some cheap garden hose and spend all of your time wrestling with it instead of using it for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: It kinks...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a burst hose length that I'd had for almost 8 years. It seems to be very good quality and it doesn't kink too easily, but I have gotten it to kink without trying too hard while watering my garden and I've only been using this hose for about a month. A great hose for the price, but it loses some stars for the bad advertising. If you want to call your product Neverkink, you need to make sure it doesn't kink!
customer_reviews.author: DMH

customer_reviews.title: Awful hose pipe
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this since it is American made and not made in communist China. If this is the pro version, I'd hate to see the amateur version. It kinks like crazy and after a dozen uses has given up at the male connector. By that, I mean that it folds, or kinks, at the connector. Piss poor hose. Embarrassing that this is Made in USA. If it were advertised as a light duty model, with half the price, I would understand.
customer_reviews.author: 123Hillbilly321

customer_reviews.title: Durable, heavy duty hose
customer_reviews.text: This is my second hose by this brand, my previous one being a 100' 3/4" size. As expected, these hoses are quite heavy duty, and have had no problem with kinks or even nicks in the casing from a weed whacker. Needless to say being commercial grade it is not light, and it can be prone to twisting if you do not use a hose reel (I don't), so if you have limited mobility or want something light look elsewhere, but if you want a hose that will last, get this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: So far so good that I actually purchased a 130 footer to use when pressure washing.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of the 75 footers last year. I haven't had any of the negative issues that others are complaining about with these hoses. Common sense is the key. When you unpack the hose there are kinks of some sort because of the bands and packaging. Up coil the hose on the lawn, connect to faucet and fill with water in sun for a hour or so to remove kinks and memory. Never leave a hose under pressure in hot sun for long periods. The sun will soften the rubber and cause bursting under pressure. Common sense people
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Does kink, but reliable hose
customer_reviews.text: This was the cheapest hose of this length I saw, and it's worth the money. It definitely does get kinks that you have to manually undo, but these seem to be at a less frequent rate than my old hose. My one complaint is that it comes very tightly coiled in the original packaging, meaning you have to initially work the curvature out of the hose, unless you are planning to re-coil it that tightly after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Ayah Muted

customer_reviews.title: No kinks
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews I was a bit scared to order this hose. I received it on Saturday May 10 and I immediately took it out, hooked it up and started watering with it. Have used it 3 times now, and so far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ghend

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Use it for a hose-powered pool vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I use it for a hose-powered pool vacuum for my in ground pool. The water pressure spins in the vacuum tool and it sucks up pool debris into the vacuum's bag! Pros: Anti - kink Great pressure Long hose I do not have any cons, it is kind of heavy but thats obvious if you want a heavy duty, anti-kink, strong hose. I highly recommend this hose! Please click helpful, so i am encouraged to come back and provide an update for future reviewers as well. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Reviews by ILoveAmazon15

customer_reviews.title: Should've been named "NeverKinkUntilItDoes Pro"
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent hose, however, it has started to kink. We've been using it for a month or two, and the last couple of times I've used it, it started kinking in a couple of spots. Considering this, I wish I had bought a lighter weight hose that's easier to move around, since it's kinking anyways. I like the length and it seems heavy duty. But if you call something the "NeverKink Pro", it shouldn't start kinking within the first month or two. Or ever. Maybe it should've been named "NeverKinkUntilItDoes Pro".
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Very good hose but never kink is an incorrect name -- maybe they should call it NotTooMuchKink
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the name it does kink every time I use it. Having said that, it is an excellent quality heavy-duty hose. If you want a good strong hose you will not go wrong with this one, just know that it will get kinks. Update: after having the hose for about 3 years and using it occasionally, the rubber cover is splitting in several places. There are 3-6 inch cracks and the insulation under the rubber is sticking out through the cracks. Revising my rating down to 2 stars....I've had a lot of cheap hoses that did not develop cracks.
customer_reviews.author: MtnYankee

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This hose was a little bit less then I was expecting. The aluminum ends are not as well machines as you would expect. The hose itself, although it would never kink, it is a bit stiff and tends to twist so it's hard to coil it up again after using it. There is some nice features about it though, I appreciate the extra large grips to tighten the ends. And its very thick wall I imagine it will last for years. I have used it for two years now and I've never had any issues
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Finally untangled!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a kinky hose. It works great, have a long driveway and had to get all the way to the end for a project. pulling the hose in and back out daily. Actually 3 hoses, including 2 of these. they seem sturdy, come with good connectors that haven't leaked a drop. Like I said, I already have 2 of them connected and have ben using them for only a few weeks, but I like the quality and many fewer kinks to slow me down from my work. All my other hoses make me work so hard to wind and unwind, these are much better than previous hoses I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: E. Motz

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% kink free, but as close as you're gonna get
customer_reviews.text: Great hose. Large diameter prevents pressure drop despite the long distance, and the rigid wall resists kinking. Of course, I still get an occasional kink, but it's a lot more manageable than any cheaper hose. My favorite feature is the reinforced spring and thread connector on the upstream end. It resists tearing no matter how much you tug on it, and also never kinks. Love this hose.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Hollas

customer_reviews.title: It kinks!
customer_reviews.text: The way it was packaged with plastic strips tightly holding it in a circular position cause the hose to kink in several places. When I call the manufacturer's customer service I was told to put it in the sun with water pressure in the hose to eliminate the kinks which they acknowledged existed. This may sound good but obviously the customer service person was reading from a script and never tried what they were advising me to do since I did as told several times and the kinks still exist!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Aukett

customer_reviews.title: Burst after 8 months. Cheap aluminum connectors. Galvinic corrosion.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 and used them for 8 months, just for light use, sprinkling grass. Both have burst under pressure. In both cases about 1/4 inch bubble formed in the plastic, then popped. Update. The cheap aluminum connectors, when mated with quality brass connectors that good heavy duty hoses have, over time cause galvinic corrosion, bonding the two hoses together. So this junky hose has permanently attached itself to my new heavy duty hose, like a parasite or funky alien. Now I have to cut the end off the new hose and fix it too.
customer_reviews.author: Mostafitty

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty hose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with some hesitation after reading several reviews about bulging and blow-outs soon after beginning use. I've had it for a few weeks now and couldn't be happier. It is a solid, well made hose. I have strong water pressure and have left the water on with a nozzle at the end for hours and have had no problems with the hose holding the water. I imagine that like any product there can sometimes be some with manufacturing defects, but I think this is a great hose at a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with product
customer_reviews.text: Surprised to be writing a review on a garden hose .... very, very pleased with product. I bought a power washer recommended for use with 3/4 in hose .... noticeable performance improvement with larger capacity hose. The hose itself is heavy duty and the hose fittings are excellent quality. I like the slim red line along the length of the hose which helps one position the hose. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Renholzberger

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy and kinks excessively
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy hose, not great for a hose reel. It will work but normally just over powers guide and wraps up the end. The never kink is a joke as well. It will kink just like ever other hose. *edit* this hose kinks more than any hose I have owned. And you cant just whip the hose to unkink have to go over and unkink by hand. This hose will end up in the garbage after the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality
customer_reviews.text: The 5/8 inch is important. Depending on what you need it for. I need the volume to drain pool water so this one works better than the other one I had before. You never know how well this last until at least a year down the road, but it seems like good quality. There is a red line along the hose so you know if it's twisted... the coupling is very good quality, doesn't leak when put on the faucet. For the price, it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: MGL

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Aluminum and brass do not mix. I put this on a brass spigot in the spring just went to remove for winter. The two had seized together and had to remove the drainage valve along with the hose and take them to the garage and put it in a large vise to unscrew the two. Won't be using this hose next year. I knew the fact that they should not be use but asked myself why would they sell this if it was going to seize. Because there is always a sucker out there.
customer_reviews.author: Texan

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty hose...great if you need one...
customer_reviews.text: this is definitely not a lightweight hose, but rather a heavy duty one. At 100', it barely fits in hose reel box, but worth every penny to me. I've tried regular hoses, the steel covered ones, and now this, and this one by far seems to be most durable. I would rather spend a little extra and get extra life instead of replacing every other year. Well worth the $s if you need something a little more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: mouth8282

customer_reviews.title: Never Kink Is Just A Fairy Tale
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived promptly. It is wrapped tightly, so much so it took six hours in 80 degree temps to relax and not look like a Slinky in my yard.. I've been using it daily for a couple of weeks. It has had one kink approximately five times. Therefore, the "never kink" is just a fairy tale. I can live with a kink every now and then, otherwise, it is a sturdy, durable, hose. I leave it stretched out in my yard at all times, so I am hoping it won't get worse, if so, I will attempt to return it.
customer_reviews.author: JLC740

customer_reviews.title: Never Again Will I Purchase NEVER KINK PRO hose
customer_reviews.text: From the very first day I used the "Never Kink Pro" I have continually had to deal with kinks! If you are thinking about buying this product I can only advise I get pissed every time I use it........... I rarely complain about anything I purchase from Amazon......... The reason I didn't return the product was, it was easier for me to buy a new hose locally and use (Never Kink Pro) only as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: jg

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight, but definitely not kink proof.
customer_reviews.text: It is NOT kink proof. No idea why they gave it that name or they claim "Guaranteed" to not kink. This is a flat out False statement. However, the hose is very light to handle and move around. The connections seem to be well made. Bottom line is that if you want a kink proof hose, look elsewhere. If you want something light weight, then this hose should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L.

customer_reviews.title: Kinks, hard to roll up, not flexible, leaks
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the worst hoses I've ever had. It is very stiff (even when laid out in the sun and used for several months) and does not flatten (unroll) well. This causes it to kink and get tangled up - the outside coating is tacky, causing it to tangle/kink even more. It is heavy and, with the tangling/twisting, makes it hard to carry. It leaks where connected to spigot.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Only two months old, and this hose has a ...
customer_reviews.text: Only two months old, and this hose has a pin hole leak coming through the middle of the hose. For a hose that feels this strong, this is such a let down. Obviously the sidewalls must be very thin for this to happen or a manufacture defect.
customer_reviews.author: Panayi74

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Hose
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this model hose for about two years. No kinking or leaking problems. I bought another to replace a failed hose by different manufacturer. Although I've only used it a couple of times, the quality, ease of use and expected lifetime is what I expected. Delivered quickly and without issue. Recommend for light to medium duty garden tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Deal Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Chemical laced, and IT KINKS! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this hose for about a year now, and I can't be more disappointed. It is cumbersome, heavy, and it kinks just like any other hose does. What a misleading name! Worst of all, however, is that every time I use this hose, the water is laced with a white foam. It smells bad and is very concerning for its chemical nature. I have never had a garden hose that has this problem. If you have children, pets, or care for the environment at all, DO NOT BUY THIS HOSE.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid hose - but it will kink.
customer_reviews.text: While better than most hoses, don't fall for the Neverkink name. It can and will kink - and if it develops a kink it doesn't go away. I've tried putting hot water through it to work out the kinks, but as soon as the hose cools down the kink returns. Still it is a strong hose that is light enough, and flexiable enough to handle. The ends are aluminum instead of brass, so that may prove a weak point in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Ron T

customer_reviews.title: Two of thes hozes in a row sprang leaks
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally left the spigot turned on with the sprayer nozzle closed. The hose burst within 24 hours (spigot not fully on, house, not road, water pressure). Figured it was my fault for not remembering to turn off the spigot, threw the hose away and bought another. Same thing happened when a workman left the spigot on. So I'm buying another hose, but not this one. If you know you'll never leave the spigot on with the nozzle closed, it might be 4 stars; otherwise, zero stars. I compromised on 2.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Symons

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. It’s no good.
customer_reviews.text: Worst hose ever. Funny they call it “never kink” because it arrived linked. Terrible bulky connector with shards of metal sticking out of it. Leaks, hard to move - terrible hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Bell Ringer

product_meta.title: Teknor Apex Neverkink, 8844-100, PRO Water Hose, 5/8-in x 100-feet,Black
product_meta.description: Size:5/8-Inch by 100-FeetOnly Neverkink hoses guarantee no kinks or tangles, the patented Reflex Mesh technology ensures a hose that's easy to maneuver. Industrial strength couplings are made with lead-free aluminum and are leak proof and crush-resistant, a heavy duty steel coil prevents kinking at faucet. All Neverkink product contains microshield, anti-microbial protection, guards against mold and mildew that can cause hose deterioration. The series 4000 Neverkink is flexible to 45 degree. This hose comes in 5/8th" and 3/4" diameter and is available in 50', 75' and 100' lengths. Made in the USA. Not for hot water use.
feature_bullets: Guaranteed not to kink or tangle
Heavy gauge power coil. This hose comes in 5/8th" and 3/4" diameter and is available in 50', 75' and 100' lengths.
Industrial strength lead-free aluminum couplings leak & crush-proof. All weather flexibility down to 45°F for ease of use and colder temperatures
Contains microshield to prevent mold and mildew
This hose is not intended for drinking water use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars6,714 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
